CoeTrends.title: COE Price Trends
CoeTrends.subtitle: Historical Certificate of Entitlement prices for motorcycles in Singapore
CoeTrends.aboutCoeDesc: Understanding Certificate of Entitlement and Prevailing Quota Premium for motorcycles
CoeTrends.whatIsCoeDesc: Certificate of Entitlement (COE) is a quota license that allows vehicle ownership in Singapore for 10 years. For motorcycles, this falls under Category D.
CoeTrends.whatIsPqpDesc: Prevailing Quota Premium (PQP) is the price to renew a COE for an additional 5 or 10 years without bidding. It is calculated by LTA as a moving average of COE premiums from the last 3 months (6 bidding exercises), updated monthly.
CoeTrends.coeVsPqpDesc: COE bidding is for new vehicles and prices fluctuate each exercise. PQP is for COE renewal of existing vehicles and is more stable as it smooths out short-term volatility.
CoeTrends.biddingProcessDesc: COE bidding occurs twice monthly. The premium is determined by the lowest successful bid when demand meets supply quota.
CoeTrends.chartFeaturesDesc: How to interpret the COE price trends
CoeTrends.timeRangesDesc: Filter data by different time periods (1Y, 2Y, 5Y, or All) to analyze short-term and long-term trends.
CoeTrends.lineChartDesc: Line Chart: Shows price and quota trends separately
CoeTrends.combinedChartDesc: Combined Chart: Overlays price line on quota bars
CoeTrends.pqpTrendLineDesc: The dashed amber line shows the PQP (Prevailing Quota Premium) — the renewal price based on a 3-month moving average of COE prices. Compare it with the bidding price to evaluate renewal timing.
CoeTrends.tooltipDataDesc: Hover over data points to see detailed information including COE price, PQP, success rates and oversubscription levels.
CoeTrends.marketInsightsDesc: Key observations from COE price trends
CoeTrends.cyclicalPatternsDesc: COE prices often show cyclical patterns influenced by economic cycles and government policies affecting vehicle ownership.
CoeTrends.quotaImpactDesc: Higher quotas generally lead to lower prices, while restricted supply during certain periods can drive prices significantly higher.
CoeTrends.seasonalTrendsDesc: End-of-year periods often see increased bidding activity as people look to purchase vehicles before year-end.

CoeChart.chartDesc: Historical COE prices with quota information ({range})
CoeChart.swipeHint: Swipe left/right to see more data points

Depreciation.title: Motorcycle Depreciation Calculator
Depreciation.subtitle: Calculate your motorcycle's depreciation rate with real-time COE prices from LTA Singapore
Depreciation.enterVehicleInfo: Enter vehicle information to see depreciation calculations
Depreciation.noteText: All time periods are displayed in days for maximum precision. COE values depreciate linearly over 3,652.5 days (10 years). Current calculation uses the latest COE price of S${price} for motorcycles from LTA Singapore.
Depreciation.howItWorks: How Motorcycle Depreciation Works in Singapore
Depreciation.coeCertificateDesc: COE is required to own a vehicle in Singapore and is valid for 3,652.5 days (10 years). The calculator displays all time periods in days for maximum precision and accurate daily depreciation tracking.
Depreciation.depreciationCalcDesc: This calculator considers both the vehicle's market depreciation and the remaining COE value based on daily depreciation calculations using current LTA prices to give you a precise assessment.
Depreciation.coeNotAvailable: COE price is not available. Please try again.
Depreciation.validationPriceMin1000: Price must be at least S$1,000
Depreciation.validationPriceMax: Price must be less than S$1,000,000
Depreciation.validationCurrentPriceMin: Price must be at least S$100
Depreciation.validationRegDateFuture: Registration date cannot be in the future
Depreciation.validationCurrentLessThanNew: Current price must be less than new price

CostCalculator.title: Motorcycle Cost Calculator
CostCalculator.subtitle: Calculate the total cost of purchasing a motorcycle in Singapore
CostCalculator.omvDesc: OMV: Open Market Value - includes purchase price, freight, insurance, handling and all other incidental charges
CostCalculator.coeDesc: COE: Certificate of Entitlement - mandatory for vehicle registration in Singapore
CostCalculator.arfDesc: ARF: Additional Registration Fee - tiered rates of 15%, 50%, and 100% based on OMV brackets
CostCalculator.exciseDutyDesc: Excise Duty: 12% levy on the OMV as determined by Singapore Customs
CostCalculator.gstDesc: GST: 9% Goods & Services Tax on OMV + Excise Duty (excludes ARF)
CostCalculator.regFeeDesc: Registration Fee: One-time fee to register the motorcycle with LTA
CostCalculator.roadTaxDesc: Road Tax: Annual fee based on engine size
CostCalculator.insuranceDesc: Insurance: Mandatory third-party and optional comprehensive
CostCalculator.maintenanceDesc: Maintenance: Regular servicing, repairs, and consumables
CostCalculator.fuelDesc: Fuel: Not included - varies by usage
CostCalculator.gstCalcDesc: GST is calculated at 9% on the total of OMV + Excise Duty only. ARF is excluded from the GST calculation base as it is a separate registration fee.
CostCalculator.arfRateDesc: Additional Registration Fee (ARF) is calculated using tiered rates:
CostCalculator.customsNoteDesc: The Singapore Customs determines the OMV by taking into account the purchase price, freight, insurance, handling and all other incidental charges to the sale and delivery of the motorcycle/scooter in Singapore. Additional documents may be required for assessment purposes.
CostCalculator.coeNotAvailable: COE price is not available. Please wait for it to load or refresh.
CostCalculator.calculationError: Error calculating costs. Please check your inputs.

PowerToWeight.title: Motorcycle Power-to-Weight Ratio Calculator
PowerToWeight.subtitle: Calculate motorcycle power-to-weight ratio and view rankings
PowerToWeight.whatIsDesc1: Power-to-Weight Ratio is the ratio of engine power to vehicle weight
PowerToWeight.whatIsDesc2: Usually measured in horsepower per kilogram (HP/kg)
PowerToWeight.whatIsDesc3: Higher power-to-weight ratio typically means better acceleration performance
PowerToWeight.whatIsDesc4: One of the important indicators for measuring motorcycle performance
PowerToWeight.formula: Power-to-Weight Ratio = Engine Power (HP) ÷ Vehicle Weight (kg)
PowerToWeight.formulaExample: Example: A 150HP motorcycle weighing 200kg has a ratio = 150 ÷ 200 = 0.75 HP/kg
PowerToWeight.note1: Vehicle weight should include fuel and necessary fluids
PowerToWeight.note2: Please refer to manufacturer's official specifications for power data
PowerToWeight.note3: Power-to-weight ratio is just one performance indicator; actual riding experience is affected by other factors
PowerToWeight.calcError: Calculation error. Please check your input data.

FuelConsumption.title: Fuel Consumption Converter
FuelConsumption.subtitle: Easily convert between MPG, km/L, and L/100km
FuelConsumption.mpgDesc1: Primarily used in the United States
FuelConsumption.mpgDesc2: Measures miles traveled per gallon of fuel
FuelConsumption.mpgDesc3: Higher values indicate better fuel efficiency
FuelConsumption.kmlDesc2: Measures kilometers traveled per liter of fuel
FuelConsumption.kmlDesc3: Higher values indicate better fuel efficiency
FuelConsumption.l100Desc3: Lower values indicate better fuel efficiency
FuelConsumption.tip1: Enter a value in any input field, and the other two units will be automatically calculated and displayed
FuelConsumption.tip2: All calculation results are rounded to two decimal places for precision
FuelConsumption.tip3: Click the "Reset All Values" button to clear all inputs and results
FuelConsumption.tip4: Suitable for comparing fuel efficiency across cars, motorcycles, and other vehicles
